p: This third Special issue presents the growing field with articles from Australia, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Chile, Croatia, Finland, Malta, Slovenia, Sweden, and Venezuela. This Special issue aims at a critical exploration of early childhood education for sustainability, and what possibilities and/or challenges the UN 2030 Agenda framework generates for Sustainable Development in Early Childhood Education and Care. The articles are presented following their themes. The studies are motivated by the task set with the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals and UNESCO’s Education 2030 Agenda, which understands that children may learn and develop competencies on sustainability, be agents of change, and actively contribute to sustainable development.
